alert.note: Alert for Bernalillo; Sandoval; Santa Fe; Torrance (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 06 at 1:07PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central and north central New Mexico, including the following counties, in central New Mexico, Bernalillo and Torrance. In north central New Mexico, Sandoval and Santa Fe. * WHEN...Until 415 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 107 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Moriarty, Edgewood, Cedar Grove, Stanley, Golden and McIntosh. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 184 and 203. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
